reviewText: Great!
Difficult to watch the suffering of these prisoners of war, but shows resilience of human spirit and power of forgiveness and mercy.

29,000+ reviews for the Hilldebrand book, and this movie has 8 reviews??

really good movie
A remarkable story about a remarkable man-the extra DVD added so much more insight than just the released movie.

Enjoyed seeing the interview and getting the personal perspective versus the Hollywood interpretation. However, having read the book prior to seeing the movie, Ms Jolie did a very good job of capturing the incredible story.
Love the movie.
A must see for everyone ALL ages especially teens and complainers of all ages

Far better version of a great movie. Tells "the rest of the story", which is even more amazing and touching than what we saw in the theaters. Hope this version makes it on Amazon - had to go to local bookstore to buy this.
Perfect example of endurance

An extraordinary and powerful true story of real heroism and courage.
Hard to watch at times but superbly directed and acted with an ending
so exhilarating it will send you over the moon. Highly recommend.

i saw bits and pieces of the movie on TV and bought the video so that i could see it from start to finis. i also purchased the sequel to it and will watch that when i can. for now it will have to wait until i can get the time to watch both

The story is amazing, simple amazing. The movie does a rather poor job of conveying the story except a few external events and really misses the point altogether. I hope someone tries to re-make this story again. Skip the movie and try the book or the audio book.
I highly recommend for everyone to see this movie
A Must see, excellent true story..........
